name: Hilton Daytona Beach / Ocean Walk Village

reviews.text: We had reservations at a different hotel made through hotwire - it was terrible, so we checked out and went to the Hilton and asked about Vacancy. It was spring break week , but we still managed to get a room on the 16th floor oceanfront for only 159.00.
reviews.title: Great Quality,Comfort, & Customer Service!

likes.disliked: — Not a strong internet connection (wireless) - they wanted 10.00 a day for a connection!! (we still got wireless on 16th floor, but it went in and out of service.)

reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable (as to be expected at all the Hilton's). The bathrooms were upgraded, the view was wonderful. The only downside would be that there was no "balcony" just the bars outside the sliding doors...it was still really nice though.
reviews.title: Really Nice Beachfront Hotel

reviews.text: All the staff (bellpersons', valet staff, front desk staff) were extremely attentive. Another downside was that there was a convention of some sort going on ...so no matter how far in advance you called to have your car brought around we still had to wait at least 15 minutes. Also, if it is busy there - don't expect to get a bellperson to your room in under a half hour.
reviews.title: A great experience!

reviews.text: While we were there only two of the four elevators in our tower were working - a MAJOR inconvenience with all of the events going on the week we were there.
reviews.title: take your car on the beach

reviews.text: The location was GREAT! Right in the middle of everything!
reviews.title: Best place on the beach, such as it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed one night at the Hilton Oceanfront. I booked my room online through the hotel direct and got a King, oceanview room for $179/night.
reviews.title: Hilton Daytona Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful resort, located at the best place possible in Daytona Beach. Very clean room, wonderful food, and the staff were very attentive.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — having to wait till 3 pm to check in

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days to attend a professional course. I counted at least 13 problems during this time. The main issues dealt with so many extra charges and poor maintenance. Examples are: hot, stuffy halls; conference rooms were freezing; dirty windows; bird poo on outdoor table and chairs, etc. The best part is its location -- on the beach and near most everything. Howvever, the numerous issues made stay not worth the money charged.
reviews.title: This hotel has issues

reviews.text: I'm here at the Hilton, staying for a 3-day convention. I'm on day 3. The hotel looks nice and is clean. The service, though, is just okay. Pretty much hotel-wide, the staff seems to be mildly pleasant, but lack the polish found at most hotels in this class. I've also found most of the staff to be fairly inattentive, not rude, just distracted, even when things are not very busy.
reviews.title: Ok, but uninspiring

likes.liked: — Hyde Park Steakhouse and the beach location

reviews.text: The one exception is the Hyde Park Steakhouse. The food was delicious and the service top-notch.
reviews.title: The place to stay on Daytona

likes.disliked: — Cost when compared to nice hotels in other resort areas

reviews.text: We decided to do a family vacation to Orlando to hit the theme parks etc. But as the trip neared the end we decided to leave the Orlando area a day early and travel to Daytona to enjoy the beach and surrounding area.
reviews.title: Not impressed in the least.

likes.liked: — The ocean view and the daytime staff
likes.disliked: — Everything and everyone else. Just terrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your destination is Daytona Beach, stay here.
reviews.title: If your destination is Daytona, stay here.

likes.liked: — The service was top shelf! Out of all the resorts we've been to, this is by far the best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here as a sort of second honeymoon/wife birthday/weekend getaway. From the moment we stepped foot in the hotel, everyone from the bellmen to the manager on duty treated us as if we were VIPs. While we touring Daytona International Speedway, we decided to extend our stay, so we call them from the infield to see if this is possible, and can we have the same room: "No problem," they say: "just stop by the front desk when you return so we can re-program your pass key". The hotel is situated right on the beach, which was a major selling point for us. Next door to the north are the Ocean Walk shops, featuring Starbucks, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., Quiznos, a pizza & wings place, Johnny Rockets (stay out of there; VERY bad/non-existant service). Next door to the south is the Daytona Beach boardwalk, featuring the pier, and several souvenier shops/eateries. The hotel itself has a coffee shop much akin to Starbucks, a sports bar/restaurant, a restaurant serving breakfast (the breakfast buffet is tremendous), lunch, and dinner. For a truly wonderful dining experience, try Hyde Park steak house, located in the North tower.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and nice staff

likes.disliked: — Very small balcony that we could not walk out onto.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side is parking. Since the hotel is situated in the middle of the tourist district, space is at a premium. If you're not willing to pay $15 a day for valet parking, the hotel has a public, unsecured lot about a block away.
reviews.title: Daytona Bike Week

reviews.text: I booked a two night weekend stay in March with my hilton points. We requested a low lying room and got it. The bell man was excellent and the valet parking guys were on top of their game. Being a quick get away for the weekend my wife and I were overall pleased with our experience at this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only concerns I would want to make other travelers aware of is the south tower is right next to the Daytona sling shot and the possiblity of noisy neighbors. The daytona sling shot is two large radio towers with a cage that thrill seekers pay to be strapped into and launched several hundred feet into the air. Because our room was right next to this we would occassionally hear people screaming if the door was open but could not hear them with the air conditioner on and the door to the very small (less than 2 feet) balcony closed.
reviews.title: The Wedding
Adequate for Daytona Beach
reviews.text: This is my second review on the Daytona Beach Hilton, and not a lot has changed in a year. Outstanding lodging is hard to find in this area; unfortunately, the Hilton is probably the best to be found here.

I had an oceanfront room this time, which did have a very lovely view of the ocean and beach. On Saturday nights, fireworks are launched from the pier that is located to the south of the Hilton. I was able to watch the display from my room. As others have indicated, the "balconies" are not balconies. You can slide open the doors and lean on a railing. There aren't enough inches to actually step out of the doors.
reviews.title: Good, But Not Great

likes.disliked: — Having to pay to park, pay for internet, price of in-hotel food / services

reviews.text: The room itself was fine--not luxorious but fine. I had a small, rather beat up loveseat; coffee table; desk with chair; king size bed with nightstands; and armoire that housed older tv and included 3 dresser drawers. The bed was amazingly comfortable and provided a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Doubt I will return

reviews.text: The bathroom includes a separate sink and vanity in dressing area, with additional sink in actual bathroom. The sinks had new countertops, but the rest of the bathroom was in need of an update.
reviews.title: Just OK

likes.liked: — Ocean views, many bars/restaurants to choose from
likes.disliked: — Small guestroom TV, service in restaurants/bars, pool area

reviews.text: Rooms are quiet and hallway noise is muted.
reviews.title: Best Ever Hotel

likes.disliked: — Could not find anything I didn't like

aka: Hilton Daytona Beach / Ocean Walk Village Hotel Daytona Beach
description: The Hilton Daytona Beach Resort/Ocean Walk Village is located in the heart of the 'World’s Most Famous Beach'. Our resort offers seven onsite restaurants and bars, a full service spa, two outdoor pools, whirlpools, fitness center and 60,000 sq/ft. of event space. You will enjoy our proximity to great local attractions and a variety of entertainment options at walking distance from our hotel.
